CS0168.shortDescription: A variável foi declarada, mas nunca foi usada

S1118.shortDescription: Utility classes should not have public constructors
S1118.fullDescription: Utility classes, which are collections of static members, are not meant to be instantiated.

S1128.fullDescription: Although unnecessary using won't change anything to the produced application, removing them:

S1135.fullDescription: TODO tags are commonly used to mark places where some more code is required, but which the developer wants to implement later.

S125.shortDescription: Sections of code should not be commented out
S125.fullDescription: Programmers should not comment out code as it bloats programs and reduces readability.

S1313.shortDescription: Using hardcoded IP addresses is security-sensitive
S1313.fullDescription: Hardcoding IP addresses is security-sensitive. It has led in the past to the following vulnerabilities:

S1481.shortDescription: Unused local variables should be removed
S1481.fullDescription: If a local variable is declared but not used, it is dead code and should be removed. Doing so will improve maintainability because developers will not wonder what the variable is used for.

S3376.shortDescription: Attribute, EventArgs, and Exception type names should end with the type being extended
S3376.fullDescription: Adherence to the standard naming conventions makes your code not only more readable, but more usable. For instance, class FirstAttribute : Attribute can be used simply with First, but you must use the full name for class AttributeOne : Attribute.

S3871.fullDescription: The point of having custom exception types is to convey more information than is available in standard types. But custom exception types must be public for that to work.

S4507.shortDescription: Delivering code in production with debug features activated is security-sensitive
S4507.fullDescription: Delivering code in production with debug features activated is security-sensitive. It has led in the past to the following vulnerabilities:
